intro: Scrophularia nudata, commonly known as common figwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along riverbanks. Scrophularia nudata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
